poem:
**Diplomatic Currents**

In corridors unseen, power treads lightly,  
Beneath tumultuous skies: the weight of words,  
Cumbersome as the winds that reshaped paths.  
A man, aged with the burden of conflict,  
Crosses vast seas of history, to whisper  
In the ear of allies. Shadows' counsel,  
While hurricanes whisper truths deeper still.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Joe Biden to visit Germany to discuss Ukraine and Middle East Joe Biden will visit Germany this week, government sources in Berlin said, after he cancelled a planned trip last week over deadly Hurricane Milton. The senior German officials who spoke on condition of anonymity confirmed media reports that the US president would travel to Berlin, probably within the next week, but declined to provide further details. Planning for the visit was believed to be". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
